result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendric Dontrell Mills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendric Dontrell Mills

records.addlTxt: A woman called on behalf of DE to get more info to pay the fine. She was given the DE's case #, bal, & advised pymt is due by 5/16/22. jaf
Order for payment on May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:48 AM  Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Kendric Dontrell Mills appeared.  Kendric Dontrell Mills appeared by video means. Atty Brekken states a resolution, court goes off record to allow Atty Dolfi time to speak with DE. Off record: 11:49 am.  Back on:  11:51 am.  Atty Dolfi states DE will take agreement. State moves to amend to County Oridnance 52. Court finds DE Guilty to Amended Ct 1; Cty Ord 52 due to guilty plea and orders court costs of $114.50. 60 DTP.  Court confirms address of DE. Bond is discharged. Adjourned: 11:53.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.

04:02 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DE Kendric Dontrell Mills pro se.  Kendric Dontrell Mills appeared by video means.  Court reviews file and explains to DE an Atty needs to be appointed, Court will reschedule.  DE can appear by zoom for next hearing to make sure an Atty has been appointed.    DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:04 PM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 10, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, X.T. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten via zoom, Clerk: Liddle, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Kendric Dontrell Mills appeared. DE qualifies for PD services. Address and DOB confirmed. Complaint should note MN not WI. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG. Court will seal the minor's name in the bond. Zoom approved if scheduling only.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
